Package project1

Class RosterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • project1.RosterManager
  • public class RosterManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Reads all user input and runs valid commands until terminated. Valid commands, besides termination command, are performed by Roster class. Commands include Add, Remove, Print roster in a Roster as well as Termination.
    Author:
    Sharukh Khan, Hamad Naveed

    • Constructor Detail

      • RosterManager

        public RosterManager()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Reads through user input and performs valid commands until terminated. If command is valid StringTokenizer separates the user input line into tokens for readability. The appropriate method is called to perform the command. While loop terminated by Q command.

      • addStudent

        private void addStudent​(Roster roster,
                        java.util.StringTokenizer input)
        Creates a student object to be added to the Roster class roster array. Method sends student input to buildStudent method. If input is invalid the output is the appropriate statement. If student is valid and not already in the student it gets added to the array in the Roster class and the appropriate statement is output. If student is already in the Roster - student does not get added to the array and the appropriate statement is output.
        Parameters:
        roster - object that correlates to the array
        input - user student input

      • removeStudentFromRoster

        private void removeStudentFromRoster​(Roster roster,
                                     java.util.StringTokenizer input)
        Removes student from the Roster class array. If student exist in the array it is deleted and the appropriate statement is printed. If student is not in the array the appropriate statement in printed.
        Parameters:
        roster - object that correlates to the array
        input - user student input

      • buildStudent

        private Student buildStudent​(java.util.StringTokenizer input)
        Creates student object using user input.
        Parameters:
        input - user student input.
        Returns:
        the student object if it is valid and created otherwise returns null.

      • getMajor

        private Major getMajor​(java.lang.String major)
        Allows user to enter major in lower-case and return the correlating Major type.
        Parameters:
        major - string input.
        Returns:
        the major data type.

      • endRoasterManager

        private static void endRoasterManager()
        Terminates program and prints termination statement.
